title: r/Talesfromthefrontdesk I Told An Adult Customer "No," So She Called Her Mommy On Me
description: r/Talesfromthefrontdesk What happens when you tell a spoiled adult customer that she can't listen to loud music in the hotel lobby? She calls her mommy on you! Then her mommy drives all the way to your hotel to yell at your manager about how rude you were to her precious daughter. Can you imagine how insanely entitled you have to be call your mommy on a complete stranger?
dc:creator: rSlash Reads Reddit
